title: How to Make Cookie Cutters from Regular Aluminum Foil

steps.headline: Tear out a sheet of aluminum foil.
Lay the sheet out so that the longest side is horizontal.
Fold up 1/2 inch (1.27cm) to 1 inch (2.5cm) section.
Continue to fold over until you have a long strip of rather sturdy foil.
steps.description: Making it this thick will help it keep its shape.

steps.headline: Fold the strip into whatever shape you desire.
steps.description: A longer sheet of foil will mean more strip to work with. Experiment with creasing the foil in different directions to find out different ways to create shapes.

steps.headline: When you have reached your desired shape, tape the ends together with whatever kind of sticky (adhesive) tape you have laying around.
steps.description: Just make sure it's clean. Try regular transparent sticky tape.

tyn: Ruler or edge to help you tear the foil
text: Tear out a sheet of aluminum foil.  Lay the sheet out so that the longest side is horizontal.  Fold up 1/2 inch (1.27cm) to 1 inch (2.5cm) section.  Continue to fold over until you have a long strip of rather sturdy foil. Making it this thick will help it keep its shape. Fold the strip into whatever shape you desire. A longer sheet of foil will mean more strip to work with. Experiment with creasing the foil in different directions to find out different ways to create shapes. When you have reached your desired shape, tape the ends together with whatever kind of sticky (adhesive) tape you have laying around. Just make sure it's clean. Try regular transparent sticky tape.
sentences: Tear out a sheet of aluminum foil.
Lay the sheet out so that the longest side is horizontal.
Fold up 1/2 inch (1.27cm) to 1 inch (2.5cm) section.
Continue to fold over until you have a long strip of rather sturdy foil.
Making it this thick will help it keep its shape.
Fold the strip into whatever shape you desire.
A longer sheet of foil will mean more strip to work with.
Experiment with creasing the foil in different directions to find out different ways to create shapes.
When you have reached your desired shape, tape the ends together with whatever kind of sticky (adhesive) tape you have laying around.
